definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)

sentences.english: A helicopter mathematical model with a slung load is described.
sentences.chinese: 建立带吊挂载荷的直升机飞行动力学模型。

sentences.english: Two ends are vertically falling to the ground, for hanging a pole.
sentences.chinese: 两个端头垂直向地面，将用于吊挂一根晾杆。

sentences.english: Vertical hanging glass-steel production line of the main purposes.
sentences.chinese: 垂直吊挂式玻璃钢化生产线主要用途。

sentences.english: To analyze the handling quality of a helicopter with the heavy slung-load, this paper presents a theoretical analysis model.
sentences.chinese: 建立带吊挂直升机飞行操纵性分析的理论分析模型。

sentences.english: In 5, the hat plug towel, flat dry, avoid hanging to dry.
sentences.chinese: 将帽子里面塞上毛巾，平放阴干，切忌吊挂晒干。

sentences.english: Walk off an edge to safely drop, grab the edge, and hang.
sentences.chinese: 走过边缘可安全落下，劳拉会自行攀住边缘并吊挂住。

sentences.english: The suspended rod may have conducted forces accumulated in the capstone.
sentences.chinese: 吊挂的竿可能传导顶石中累积的力量。

sentences.english: With excellent leaves and flowers, plant in Asclepiadaceae is a good material for suspension and vertical greening.
sentences.chinese: 此科植物叶花俱佳，是吊挂和垂直绿化的良好材料。

definition: a boom (i.e. transverse beam for hanging objects)
rope tackle hanging from a mast/crow foot (system of ropes through tackle to hold up an awning)
to install/to fit (e.g. a light bulb)
to set up/to arrange/to lay out
